sen.j: 安康天皇（あんこうてんのう、履中天皇2年（401年）？ - 安康天皇3年8月9日 (旧暦)（456年9月24日））は、第20代の天皇（在位：允恭天皇42年12月14日 (旧暦)（454年1月28日） - 安康天皇3年8月9日（456年9月24日））。
sen.e: Emperor Anko (c. 401 - September 24, 456), whose reign was from January 28, 454 to September 24, 456, was the 20th Emperor.
Emperor Anko (c. 401 - September 24, 456), who reigned from January 28, 454, to September 24, 456, was the twentieth Emperor.
sen.cmt: 表現・統一用語の修正を加えました
sen.e: Emperor Anko (c. 401 - September 24, 456), who reigned from January 28, 454, to September 24, 456, was the twentieth Emperor.

sen.j: 穴穂天皇・穴穂皇子（あなほのみこ）。
sen.e: Also known as Anaho no Sumeramikoto (Emperor) or Anaho no Miko (Prince).
He was also known as Anaho no Sumeramikoto (Emperor) or Anaho no Miko (Prince).
sen.cmt: 主語動詞を加えました
sen.e: He was also known as Anaho no Sumeramikoto (Emperor) or Anaho no Miko (Prince).

sen.j: 中国の『宋書』・『梁書』に記される「倭の五王」中の倭王興に比定されている。
sen.e: Emperor Anko is identified as king 興 among the Five Kings of Wa (ancient name of Japan in Chinese) described in Chinese Sungshu (book of Sun Dynasty) and Liangshu (book of Liang Dynasty).

Emperor Anko is identified as King Ko of Wa (supposedly, Japan) among the Five Kings of Wa described in Chinese history books "So-jo" (Sung-shu in Chinese or the Book of Song) and "Ryo-jo" (Liang-shu in Chinese or the Book of Liang).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・形式上の修正を加えました。参考：http://kotobank.jp/word/倭王興

sen.j: 允恭天皇42年1月（453年2月）に允恭天皇が崩御する。
sen.e: In January 453, Emperor Ingyo demised.
In February, 453, Emperor Ingyo demised.
sen.cmt: 和暦を西暦換算の上、原文に補足し、英文を修正しました。換算ツール：http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: In February, 453, Emperor Ingyo demised.

sen.j: 皇太子の木梨軽皇子（きなしのかるのみこ）には近親相姦の前科が有ったために群臣は皆従わず、弟の穴穂皇子の側に付いた。
sen.e: Ingyo's retainers were not subjected to imperial prince Kinashi no Karu no Miko due to his previous conviction for incest, so they took side with his younger brother, Anaho no Miko.
Ingyo's retainers did not follow the Crown Prince Kinashi no Karu no Miko due to his previous conviction for incest, and they took side with the Crown Prince's younger brother, Anaho no Miko.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: Ingyo's retainers did not follow the Crown Prince Kinashi no Karu no Miko due to his previous conviction for incest, and they took side with the Crown Prince's younger brother, Anaho no Miko.

sen.j: 軽皇子は穴穂皇子を討ち殺そうとして兵を集める。
sen.e: Karu no Miko assembled soldiers to kill Anaho no Miko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Karu no Miko assembled soldiers to kill Anaho no Miko.
Karu no Miko assembled soldiers to kill Anaho no Miko.

sen.j: だが、群臣が離反していく不利な現況を悲嘆して、物部大前宿禰（もののべのおおまえのすくね）の家に潜んだ。
sen.e: However, Karu no Miko finally hid in the residence of MONONOBE no Omae no Sukune, disappointed by an adverse situation in which his retainers turned against one after another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, disappointed by an adverse situation in which the retainers turned against him one after another, Karu no Miko finally hid in the residence of MONONOBE no Omae no Sukune.
sen.cmt: 文法・文脈上の修正を加えました
sen.e: However, disappointed by an adverse situation in which the retainers turned against him one after another, Karu no Miko finally hid in the residence of MONONOBE no Omae no Sukune.

sen.j: 穴穂皇子が率いる兵に包囲され、大前宿禰の計らいで戦は避けられたが、軽皇子は自裁した（尚、『古事記』では道後温泉に流罪となったと記される）。
sen.e: Though Karu no Miko was beleaguered by the soldiers lead by Anaho no Miko, he the battle could be avoided thanks to the help by Omae no Sukune; Karu no Miko finally killed himself (according to ''Kojiki'' (the Records of Ancient Matters), Karu no Miko was deported to Dogo-onsen hotspring).

Although Karu no Miko was beleaguered by the soldiers led by Anaho no Miko, the battle was avoided at the discretion of Omae no Sukune, and Karu no Miko killed himself (but, according to ''Kojiki'' [literally, the Records of Ancient Matters], Karu no Miko was exiled to Dogo-onsen).
sen.cmt: 用語・形式・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: Although Karu no Miko was beleaguered by the soldiers led by Anaho no Miko, the battle was avoided at the discretion of Omae no Sukune, and Karu no Miko killed himself (but, according to ''Kojiki'' [literally, the Records of Ancient Matters], Karu no Miko was exiled to Dogo-onsen).

sen.j: こうして、穴穂皇子は12月に皇位を践祚した。
sen.e: Thus, Anaho no Miko ascended to the imperial throne in December.
Thus, Anaho no Miko ascended to the imperial throne in December.
Thus, Anaho no Miko ascended to the imperial throne in December.

sen.j: 安康天皇元年（454年）、根使主の讒言を信じて大草香皇子（仁徳天皇の皇子）を誅殺し、翌年にその妃であった中蒂姫を皇后に立てた。
sen.e: In 454, Emperor Anko executed Okusaka no Miko who was a prince of Emperor Nintoku, believing the slanderous report by Ne no Omi; next year, Emperor Anko settled Nakashi Hime, an ex-wife of Okusaka no Miko, as his empress.

In 454, Emperor Anko, who believed the slanderous report by Ne no Omi, executed Okusaka no Miko who was a son of Emperor Nintoku, and the next year Emperor Anko took Nakashihime, the ex-wife of Okusaka no Miko, as his empress consort.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・文脈上の修正を加えました
sen.e: In 454, Emperor Anko, who believed the slanderous report by Ne no Omi, executed Okusaka no Miko who was a son of Emperor Nintoku, and the next year Emperor Anko took Nakashihime, the ex-wife of Okusaka no Miko, as his empress consort.

sen.j: 同3年8月9日 (旧暦)（456年9月24日）、天皇は中蒂姫の連れ子眉輪王（まよわのおおきみ）により暗殺された。
sen.e: In September 24, 456, Emperor Anko was assassinated by Mayowa no Okimi, a child by Nakashihime's former marriage.
In September 24, 456, Emperor Anko was assassinated by Mayowa no Okimi, a child by Nakashihime's former marriage.
In September 24, 456, Emperor Anko was assassinated by Mayowa no Okimi, a child by Nakashihime's former marriage.

sen.j: 『古事記』『旧事紀』に享年56、『帝王編年記』に享年54と伝えられる。
sen.e: He died at the age of 56 according to ''Kojiki'' and ''Kyujiki'' (ancient Japanese historical text), while Teio Hennen ki (the Chronicle of Emperors) records he was 54.
Emperor Anko died at the age of 56 according to the ''Kojiki'' and ''Kujiki'' (ancient Japanese historical text), or 54 according to "Teio hennenki" (literally, Annals of the emperor).
sen.cmt: 書名の読み・形式上の修正を加えました
sen.e: Emperor Anko died at the age of 56 according to the ''Kojiki'' and ''Kujiki'' (ancient Japanese historical text), or 54 according to "Teio hennenki" (literally, Annals of the emperor).

sen.j: 皇太子を指名することなく崩御したが、従兄弟の市辺押磐皇子（履中天皇の皇子）を皇位継承者に立てる腹積もりであったとされる。
sen.e: Though the Emperor passed away without designating crown prince, it is considered that he planned to choose his cousin Ichinobe no Oshiha no Miko (prince of Emperor Richu) as an heir to the imperial throne.

Although the Emperor passed away without designating the crown prince, it is considered that he planned to choose his cousin Ichinohe (or Ichinobe) no Oshiha no Miko (son of Emperor Richu) as his heir to the imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 人名の補足・形式・用語上の修正を加えました
sen.e: Although the Emperor passed away without designating the crown prince, it is considered that he planned to choose his cousin Ichinohe (or Ichinobe) no Oshiha no Miko (son of Emperor Richu) as his heir to the imperial throne.

sen.j: 兄である木梨軽皇子には近親相姦疑惑があったとされているが、安康天皇も近親相姦をしていたのではないかという説がある。
sen.e: Some theory insist Emperor Anko involved in incest as well as his brother Kinashi no Karu no Miko who was suspected of incest.
While Emperor Anko's brother Kinashi no Karu no Miko was suspected of incest, one theory has it that Emperor Anko, too, allegedly committed incest.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: While Emperor Anko's brother Kinashi no Karu no Miko was suspected of incest, one theory has it that Emperor Anko, too, allegedly committed incest.

sen.j: これは、古事記に大草香皇子を殺した後、妻にした皇后が同母姉である長田大娘皇女とされているためである。
sen.e: The reason is based on a record that Emperor Anko took his older maternal half-sister, Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo (Nakashi Hime), to his empress after he executed Okusaka no Miko, according to Kojiki.
This is based on a statement in the "Kojiki" that Emperor Anko took his older sister, Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo (Nakashihime), as his empress consort after he had executed Okusaka no Miko.
sen.cmt: 表現・用語上の修正を加えました
sen.e: This is based on a statement in the "Kojiki" that Emperor Anko took his older sister, Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo (Nakashihime), as his empress consort after he had executed Okusaka no Miko.

sen.j: ただし日本書紀の雄略紀では安康天皇の妻は履中天皇の皇女である中磯皇女とし、亦の名は長田大娘皇女と註を付けている。
sen.e: However, in Yuryakuki of Nihon-shoki (Chronicles of Japan), it is commented that the wife of Emperor Anko was Nakashi no Ojo, an imperial princess of Emperor Richu, and her alternative name was Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo.

However, the Yuryaku-ki of "Nihon shoki" (literally, Chronicles of Japan) stated that the wife of Emperor Anko was Nakashi no Ojo, a daughter of Emperor Richu, and annotated that her alternative name was Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo.
sen.cmt: 用語・形式・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: However, the Yuryaku-ki of "Nihon shoki" (literally, Chronicles of Japan) stated that the wife of Emperor Anko was Nakashi no Ojo, a daughter of Emperor Richu, and annotated that her alternative name was Nagata no Oiratsume no Ojo.

sen.j: 他にも姉弟ではあるが母親は違うのではないかという説も出ている。
sen.e: According to another theory, Emperor Anko's wife was his stepsister with different mothers.
According to another theory, Emperor Anko and his wife were allegedly siblings with different mothers.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: According to another theory, Emperor Anko and his wife were allegedly siblings with different mothers.

Emperor Anko was buried in Sugawara no fushimi no nishi no misasagi Mausoleum.

The mausoleum is identified as Kojo-ichigo-fun (literally, old castle No.1 tumulus) at 4-chome, Horai, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
The mausoleum is identified as Kojo-ichigo-fun (literally, old castle No.1 tumulus) at 4-chome, Horai, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: しかし近年の調査結果から、古墳ではなく中世の山城跡とする見方が強い。
sen.e: However, according to the recent research, Kojo-ichigo tumulus is widely thought to be the ruin of mountainous castle in medieval period.
However, as a result of research conducted in recent years, the Kojo-ichigo-fun Tumulus is widely viewed not to be a tumulus but the ruin of a medieval mountain castle.
